title: Videos pause when Firefox isn't the focus
content: Videos pause when Firefox isn't the focus, most often I'll have it playing on my second monitor when doing something else. I find this most often happens with streams but not exclusively. I also find that it's more likely to happen when I have a game in the focus on my main monitor. If I have the game open but not in focus I find that this issue happens significantly less (even if that doesn't significantly change the impact the game has on my computer). This is a new issue that appeared sometime within the last month or so and wasn't there for years prior.
creator: Gron

title: Disable dialog asking to open a link in application
content: Some application registered links to a certain pattern of URLs to itself. Now every time I try to go to such address, a dialog pops up and asks to open that link in that application, but I neither have that application anymore nor am I interested in doing that. How can I make FF forget that application's setting?

title: Inhibits Power Management
content: Firefox inhibits power management, causing the screensaver to not activate. This happens when I am not running a video. It happens if I open a website that has video but I do not run the video. If I turn off Firefox the screensaver works. Screensaver is set to activate at 5 minutes. Power Management is set to turn off screen when inactive for 7 minutes. Linuxmint 21.3. and on another computer - Linuxmint 22.0
creator: borgward

title: Firefox 132.0 update deleted all of my bookmarks!
content:
Firefox updated from 131 to 132 and deleted all bookmarks, history and emptied the bookmarkbackups folder. It displays a message that a Firefox file is open by another application and that some security software can cause this problem. According to Task Manager there are no other applications running, nor is security software running. (I turned off Windows Defender and rebooted.) The problem persists. If I can't recover the 80 or so complex bookmarks, I'll have to try MS Edge browser. I'm sure that months of history is not recoverable and is lost forever.

Was this software quality tested prior to distribution? If so, it wasn't very thorough.

Why does Firefox delete files and folders during an update? It would be better to make a backup copies prior to unleashing a destructive update on unsuspecting users.

Before you ask, no I don't create full backups because a) my laptop is used 12 x 7 weekly, b) a 4TB SSD full backup takes days, not hours depending on the destination and c) a 4TB SSD differential backup takes more than a day. I've tried both and they are not practical.
creator: tech64

title: Options for bookmark dialog pop-up window - its too small
content:
Hello - I love and always recommend firefox, thank you!

One small aspect that I frequently struggle with is the small size of the bookmarks dialog pop-up window. When adding or editing a bookmark, the window only shows a very small view of the folders which makes it hard to navigate to the folder I want to place the bookmark in.

I have search extensively for extensions and settings which could provide a larger visualization, so that more of the folder browser could be seen at once, but not found any options.

Can the mozilla team suggest any work around for this, or submit this as a request to increase the size of the viewable folder tree when adding a bookmark?

title: Problemi sincronizzazione cronologia, scorciatoie e navigazione su alcune pagine
content: Ripropongo il post in oggetto in quanto sono stato invitato a creare un bug via posta attraverso un link su "bugzilla" ma, pur dopo l'accesso, non è possibile trovare nulla che faccia riferimento in modo chiaro ed esplicito sul come inserie un bug! Vengo nuovamente rimandato a questa pagine. In sostanza da un pò di tempo o in seguito ad un aggiornamento di Firefox o in seguito (ma non credo) all'aggiornamento sistema operativo in Ubuntu 24.04.1, non viene più sincronizzata la cronologia così come le scorciatoie se non dopo tempi lunghi. Aprire libero diventa inoltre molto lungo. Si attendono minuto prima di vedere la pagina iniziale. La cronologia dopo diverso tempo appare così come le icone delle scorciatorie che comunque non appaiono tutte ma in parte e comunque senza nome o anteprima. Da questo browser ultimamente continuo ad avere solo guai e mi piacerebbe ritornare ad una versione precedente piuttosto che continuare con questo delirio. Inutile andare a cancellare il profilo o crearne uno nuovo. Nulla! Questo accade anche su altri PC sincronizzati con firefox! Potete aiutarmi? Grazie

title: Firefox desktop updates changing a parameter in LastPass that opens a security hole
content:
When I install a desktop firefox update, the extension parameter in LastPass, that will let me close LastPass if not used for 30 minutes, is changed. The option is unclicked and the time removed. So every update, I have to check the LastPass extension parameters - a total pain.

If I don't notice, this means lastpass and all my passwords are left open and available to a hacker all the time. I chose a close time because I want to. Probably others do, too.

Please try to identify and find what in your updates is changing this option and STOP doing that. Or provide a warning of what parameters need to be checked/will be changed. Thanks

title: Modifiche indesiderate alle impostazioni di Firefox dopo aggiornamento
content:
Con la presente segnalo una problematica ricorrente relativa al browser Firefox.

Normalmente, dopo un aggiornamento, il browser si apre su una pagina di Mozilla contenente le novità della nuova versione. Questa volta, invece, all'apertura del browser dopo l'aggiornamento: - Si è caricata una pagina Microsoft - Sono stato automaticamente reindirizzato al motore di ricerca Bing (che ho cancellato dalle impostazioni)

Non è la prima volta che, successivamente a un aggiornamento, succede. Questo evento si verifica con cadenza pressoché annuale.

Ho già effettuato verifiche preventive utilizzando il software antivirus AVG, che non ha riscontrato alcun problema di malware.

Chiedo cortesemente un chiarimento in merito a questi reindirizzamenti non richiesti.

Cordiali saluti, Renzo

title: windows taskbar autohide - taskbar not unhiding with Firefox window maximised
content:
To fix this : Find firefox.exe (right click the firefox icon on taskbar - if you have one - then right click again on the firefox icon in dialog)

Firefox.exe > properities > compatibility tab > change high dpi settings > high dpi setting override > set to system

This appears to fix the issue (for me anyway on latest win11 pro) I cant be the only one for whom this was a daily frustration - and couldn't find an answer on this forum. If someone knows another fix please let me know. Cheers.

title: CPU busy
content:
Hello, I have 3 PCs. One is Windows 10, Firefox 131.0.3 One is Windows 10 firefox 131.0 One is windows 11 firefox 131.0.3

All 3 PCs are running BOINC, using the remaining CPU power up to 100%

On PC W10 + FF 131.0 and PC W11 + FF131.0.3 OINC and FF share the processor time up to 100% On the PC W10 + FF 131.0.3 when FF is dispatched, nno processor time is assigned to BOINC and CPU busy is no more 100%. This situation occurs frequently and can last several minutes.

title: Eşitleme sonrası cihazlarımda yer imleri silindi
content: Bilgisayarımda ve android telefonumda firefoxu, heasbımla birlikte aktif olarak kullanıyordum ve eşitleme düzgün çalışıyordu. Ancak bilgisayara format atmak zorunda kaldım. Format sonrası firefoxu kurup hesabımla giriş yaptığımda yer imlerini eşitledi ve yer imi yöneticisinde görebildim. Ancak ne olduysa anlamadım tüm yer imlerim hesabımdan silindi ve eşitleme açık olduğu için telefonumdan da silindi malasef. Profil kısmında bilgisayarım ve telefonum aktif görünüyor ve sık sık online ve eşitlenmiş görünüyor. Hesaptan çıkıp tekrar giriş yaptığımda sorun çözülmüyor, yüklediğim eklentiler yükleniyor ancak yer imleri geri gelmiyor. Forumlarda söylenen birkaç yolu denedim ama çözüm olmadı. Bu yer imlerinin online bir yedeği yok mudur veya sabit disk üzerinden kurtarmanın başka yolu yokmudur? Yardım bekliyorum.

title: Open downloaded images do not get focus
content: Using latest Firefox version (132.0) on Windows 10. For a few days now, something weird is happening with my Firefox. On browsing the internet with an image on a page and I right-click and save it, it gets properly saved to my downloads folder. Then, on Firefox, when I click on the downloads button and pick the just downloaded image, it opens the app with the image (in my case, irfanview), but the iview window does not get focus, it stays behind the Firefox window. If I click on the iview window on the taskbar, or minimize the Firefox window, I can see the image, the iview window is not minimized or anything. The problem is definitely with Firefox. I went to Windows settings, changed the image handling app to Windows Photos and the same thing happened. I have disabled all Firefox extensions and the issue still surfaces. Same thing if I start a new Firefox private window, so I am clueless as what is causing this. Even more puzzling, the problem only happens with images, PDF files, for example, open fine and Adobe Reader window gets focus and I can see the file right away. Tried to create a new Firefox profile, just in case, and I have the same problem. What changed since this was working fine? Just Firefox and Windows updates, nothing else changed, I didn't touch Firefox settings at all. Any ideas? Thanks for your help.

title: Opening Tabs By Itself
content: Honestly, I feel that this is more of a security question, but this is what happened: I had locked my laptop and walked away for a few hours. When I came back, Firefox had closed two of my tabs and opened three new ones, 2 of which were youtube videos that were playing music while my computer was locked. All of the tabs were centered around a gif that I looked up using a chat site's tenor keyboard and never actually sent. Why in the world did my locked laptop have a bunch of random tabs open? How do I stop this from happening in the future so I don't have to switch browsers? I did not like coming home to this at all. I ran a virus scan, but the only thing on my computer that was off was Firefox itself, so that's why I'm asking. This has never happened before, but I had to reinstall this browser a couple days ago so I'm wondering if there's some sort of bug or something that came with the new install. Please ease my mind about this.
creator: loseyourhands
